result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Chmiel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: *AODA and any follow-up treatment recommended by the agent

*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Chmiel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: - gave another copy to jail on 9-13-16 per request. mkv

Defendant Michael A Chmiel in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Michael A Chmiel in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee states that the parties are not asking for a PSI to be ordered.  
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and states that his client is hoping to get the help he needs with his addiction problem.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 1 year Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
*Defendant is remanded into custody
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*AODA and any follow-up treatment recommended by the agent
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Eligible for Challange Incarceration Program
*Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Credit = 0 days
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning or possession of a firearm.
Letter from Atty Hendee; reset Jury Trial set for Sept. 15th, Detective not available - Ok'd by Judge.

Final pre-trial on September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's copy of Notice of Hearing/Scheduling Conference returned undeliverable - Moved left no forwarding info - Unable to Forward per USPS
from Atty Hendee asking to reschedule the Jury Trial for July 14th; ok'd by Judge.

Scheduling conference on June 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
TRANSCRIPT OF ARRAIGNMENT ON 12/17/15- KAREN BLAIR, REPORTER

Final pre-trial at 05-27-2016 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 07-14-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Chmiel in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Michael A Chmiel in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided; however, that offer was withdrawn and the parties are not yet resolved.  
Atty Gumz agrees and asks that this be set for Trial.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 02-04-2016 10:45 am

Defendant Michael A Chmiel in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties are close to resolution.  Atty Gumz agrees and asks for a little more time.  Defendant is in Waushara County Jail.
Court questions if counsel would like to go ahead with the arraignment.
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.  Set for Plea.
bond continued.
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Arraignment at 12-17-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Michael A Chmiel in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee asks for time to file the information with the Court as there is a change in the charge statute.  Atty Gumz has no objection.  

BY THE COURT:  Court gives 30 days for the information to be filed by the State.
Set for Arraignment.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
State's
Preliminary hearing at 11-19-2015 10:00 am
Preliminary hearing at 11-04-2015 10:00 am
*Appear for booking before he goes back to Waushara County.

Defendant Michael A Chmiel in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Michael A Chmiel in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond based on that the defendant is in custody already.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is in Waushara County at this time and asks for a $100 cash bail.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $100 cash bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking before he goes back to Waushara County.

Atty Hendee objects to the cash bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend his decision and sets a $1,000 signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking before he goes back to Waushara County.

Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Order to Produce
